_header: Glad and blithe mote ye be
Note: Trans. of Bernard of Clairvaux, ‘Laetabundus’. For related texts see 4451, 5342.
_description: A macaronic song of the Nativity — thirty-eight lines generally in 6-line stanzas

BodArcSelB26.First Lines:
Glad & blithe mote ȝe beAll that euer y here now
                        seAlleluya…
BodArcSelB26.Last Lines:
…Whomme techeth þe letterBy holde the childe þe
                    betterHym bare a maide moder marye
